content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --STRESC
      operator: non_empty
    - name: --STRESC
      operator: matches_regex
      value: ^-?(0|[1-9]\d*)(\.\d+)?$
    - name: --STRESN
      operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.88
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: When --STRESC represents numeric data, --STRESN must be populated.
Outcome:
  Message: --STRESC must be populated as --ORRES is populated
  Output Variables:
    - --STRESC
    - --STRESN
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '88'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: --STRESN will only contain data values if the data
                  values presented in --STRESC are numeric values
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 4.5.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: When --STRESC represents numeric data, --STRESN must be populated.

Outcome.Message: --STRESC must be populated as --ORRES is populated

Citations.Cited_Guidance: --STRESN will only contain data values if the data values presented in --STRESC are numeric values
